title: Physics Motion and Social Inquiry: Collaborative Project for K-12

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematical Computation Skills, Fundamental Understanding of Physical Phenomena in Daily Life
context.additional_context: A collaborative learning environment using digital devices, with continuous feedback through formative assessments.

learning_goals: Through real-world case analysis, learners can quantitatively explain the physical relationships between speed, acceleration, force, and mass.
Based on data collected during cooperative learning, learners can write reports linking social phenomena (traffic/construction, etc.) to physical concepts.
Learners can simulate physics motion problems using digital tools and visually represent the results.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
